name: A-type (white)
notes: Bright, short-lived; good for ancient ruins, bad for stability.

name: F-type (yellow-white)
notes: Warm, stable enough; good 'space opera' suns.

name: G-type (yellow)
notes: Gold standard. Familiar climates, lots of room for variety.

name: K-type (orange)
notes: Long-lived and steady; excellent for old empires.

name: M-type (red dwarf)
notes: Close habitable zone; tides, flares, and weird day/night regimes.

name: White Dwarf
notes: Afterlife sun. Great for relic systems and desperate habitats.

name: Neutron Star
notes: High radiation; life is unlikely without shielding or tech.
